data.name: Description_Category_VoxelHands
data.value: The magic hands of a world shaper.

data.name: Quote00Text
data.value: Had I been present at the Creation, I would have given some useful hints for the better ordering of the universe.

data.name: Quote01Text
data.value: Don‚Äôt depend too much on anyone in this world, because even your own shadow leaves you when you are in darkness.

data.name: Quote02Text
data.value: The nourishment of the body is food, while the nourishment of the soul is feeding others.

data.name: Quote03Text
data.value: People pretend not to like grapes when the vines are too high for them to reach.

data.name: Quote04Text
data.value: Consider your origins: you were not made that you might live as brutes, but so as to follow virtue and knowledge.

data.name: Quote05Text
data.value: Remember what punishments befell us in this world when we ourselves did not cherish learning nor transmit it to other men.

data.name: Quote07Text
data.value: All the world's a stage, and all the men and women merely players.

data.name: Quote08Text
data.value: It is easy to be brave behind a castle wall.

data.name: Quote10Text
data.value: He took over anger to intimidate subordinates, and in time anger took over him.

data.name: Quote11Text
data.value: Without knowledge action is useless and knowledge without action is futile.

data.name: Quote12Text
data.value: Run away from greatness and greatness will follow you.

data.name: Quote13Text
data.value: Good actions are a guard against the blows of adversity.

data.name: Quote14Text
data.value: Be at peace with your own soul, then heaven and earth will be at peace with you.

data.name: Quote15Text
data.value: Even brute beasts and wandering birds do not fall into the same traps or nets twice.

data.name: Quote16Text
data.value: Oh, most valiant soldiers and descendants of invincible ancestors, be not degenerate, but recall the valor of your progenitors.

data.name: Quote17Text
data.value: If you bear the cross gladly, it will bear you.

data.name: Quote18Text
data.value: A man‚Äôs home is his castle.

data.name: Quote19Text
data.value: Only the artist, not the fool, discovers that which nature hides.

data.name: Quote20Text
data.value: If people knew how hard I worked to get my mastery, it wouldn't seem so wonderful at all.

data.name: Quote21Text
data.value: We come here with no peaceful intent, but ready for battle, determined to avenge our wrongs and set our country free. Let your masters come and attack us: we are ready to meet them beard to beard.

data.name: Quote22Text
data.value: I am not afraid; I was born to do this.

data.name: Quote23Text
data.value: Let no man who is not a Mathematician read the elements of my work.

data.name: Quote24Text
data.value: He who does not punish evil commands that it be done.

data.name: Quote25Text
data.value: Mechanics is the paradise of the mathematical sciences, because by means of it one comes to the fruits of mathematics.

data.name: Quote26Text
data.value: It is easier to resist at the beginning than at the end.

data.name: Quote27Text
data.value: Science is the observation of things possible, whether present or past; prescience is the knowledge of things which may come to pass, though but slowly.

data.name: Quote28Text
data.value: Wars do not just go away, they are only postponed to someone else's advantage.

data.name: Quote29Text
data.value: God is not willing to do everything, and thus take away our free will and that share of glory which belongs to us.

data.name: Quote30Text
data.value: Wars begin when you will, but they do not end when you please.

data.name: Quote31Author
data.value: Emperor Fredrick II, Holy Roman Empire

data.name: Quote31Text
data.value: He who defends everything defends nothing.

data.name: Quote32Text
data.value: For even he who is most greedy for knowledge can achieve no greater perfection than to be thoroughly aware of his own ignorance.

data.name: Quote33Text
data.value: Give me a lever long enough and a fulcrum on which to place it, and I shall move the world.

data.name: Quote34Text
data.value: Nature never breaks her own laws.

data.name: Quote36Text
data.value: Where there is shouting, there is no true knowledge.

data.name: Quote37Text
data.value: I have offended God and mankind because my work didn't reach the quality it should have.

data.name: Quote38Text
data.value: All our knowledge has its origins in our perceptions.

data.name: Quote39Text
data.value: By denying scientific principles, one may maintain any paradox.

data.name: Quote40Text
data.value: Mathematics is the language in which God has written the universe.

data.name: Quote41Text
data.value: If I were again beginning my studies, I would follow the advice of Plato and start with mathematics.

data.name: Quote43Text
data.value: To the optimist, the glass is half full. To the pessimist, the glass is half empty. To the engineer, the glass is twice as big as it needs to be.

data.name: Quote44Text
data.value: The supreme art of war is to subdue the enemy without fighting.

data.name: Quote45Text
data.value: He who knows when he can fight and when he cannot, will be victorious.

data.name: Quote46Text
data.value: Invincibility lies in the defence; the possibility of victory in the attack.

data.name: Quote47Text
data.value: Confront them with annihilation, and they will then survive; plunge them into a deadly situation, and they will then live. When people fall into danger, they are then able to strive for victory.

data.name: Quote48Text
data.value: If you are far from the enemy, make him believe you are near.

data.name: Quote49Text
data.value: It is only the enlightened ruler and the wise general who will use the highest intelligence of the army for the purposes of spying, and thereby they achieve great results.

data.name: Quote50Text
data.value: If ignorant both of your enemy and yourself, you are certain to be in peril.

data.name: Quote51Text
data.value: It is easier to find men who will volunteer to die, than to find those who are willing to endure pain with patience.

data.name: Quote52Text
data.value: Pri≈°iel som, videl som, zv√≠≈•azil som.

data.name: Quote53Text
data.value: Cowards die many times before their actual deaths.

data.name: Quote54Text
data.value: I love the name of honor, more than I fear death.

data.name: Quote56Text
data.value: There are no ordinary moments. There is always something going on.

data.name: Quote57Text
data.value: When you were born, you cried and the world rejoiced. Live your life so that when you die, the world cries and you rejoice.

data.name: Quote58Text
data.value: Certain things catch your eye, but pursue only those that capture your heart.

data.name: Quote59Text
data.value: The mind is everything. What you think you become.

data.name: Quote60Text
data.value: There are only two mistakes one can make along the road to truth; not going all the way, and not starting.

data.name: Quote61Text
data.value: Better than a thousand hollow words, is one word that brings peace.

data.name: Quote62Text
data.value: There is nothing impossible to him who will try.

data.name: Quote63Text
data.value: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.

data.name: DisplayName_Block_StoneBattlementSlopeLongMirrorLeftTop
data.value: Battlement Slope Long Mirrored Left Top

data.name: Description_Tool_LandscapeStake
data.value: Landscape stakes can be placed in the ground or on blocks. When they are connected together with ropes they will form a plane that can be used with the shovel tool to create level or sloped ground. Planes are formed from triangles or squares. Any shape with more sides must be broken into more basic shapes.

data.name: DisplayName_HouseHalfStoneDoubleWindowsCube
data.value: House Half Stone Double Windows Cube

data.name: DisplayName_Block_StoneWallRoundLargeDoorOffsetBoth
data.value: Large Round Wall, Double Entrance Offset

data.name: DisplayName_Block_StoneWallRoundLargeDoorOffsetLeft
data.value: Large Round Wall, Right Entrance Offset

data.name: DisplayName_Block_StoneWallRoundLargeDoorOffsetRight
data.value: Large Round Wall, Left Entrance Offset

data.name: Description_Faction_Engineers
data.value: Association of craftsman trained in engineering. Engineers design, build, and maintain machines and structures.

data.name: ContextMenu_ChangeAreaName_Tooltip
data.value: Area Name: Set the name of this area.

data.name: ContextMenu_ChangeAreaOwner_Tooltip
data.value: Owner: Set the owner of this area.

data.name: ContextMenu_ChangeAreaSharing_Tooltip
data.value: Share Options: Set who can build, deconstruct and mine in this area.

data.name: ContextMenu_ChangeAreaSpawnOptions_Tooltip
data.value: Respawn options: Set who can respawn here.

data.name: ContextMenu_ClaimedAreaSettings_Tooltip
data.value: Area Settings: Show owner, name and spawning settings for the area.

data.name: ContextMenu_PayTaxes_Tooltip
data.value: Zaplati≈• dane: Zaplati≈• dane sa t√∫to oblas≈•.

data.name: ContextMenu_RespawnAtStart_Tooltip
data.value: Safe area: Select the safe area as your respawn location.

data.name: ContextMenu_RespawnInClaimed_Tooltip
data.value: Claimed area: Respawn in a claimed area that you have access to.

data.name: ContextMenu_RespawnInSiege_Tooltip
data.value: Siege camp: Respawn in a siege camp that you have access to.

data.name: ContextMenu_RespawnLast_Tooltip
data.value: Respawn at the last place you respawned.

data.name: ContextMenu_SelectedPlayersAllies_Tooltip
data.value: Povoli≈• vybran√Ωm hr√°ƒçom pr√≠stup do tejto oblasti.

data.name: ContextMenu_SelectPlayersNewOwner_Tooltip
data.value: Urƒçi≈• vybran√©ho hr√°ƒça ako nov√©ho vlastn√≠ka oblasti.

data.name: ContextMenu_Condition_NotOffline
data.value: Vypnut√©, lebo hr√°≈° hru pre jedn√©ho hr√°ƒça.

data.name: ContextMenu_Condition_NeedsMoreThanOnePlayer
data.value: Disabled because there are no other players in the world.

data.name: ContextMenu_Condition_NoBed
data.value: Disabled because you have not chosen a bed where you can respawn.

data.name: ContextMenu_Condition_NoClaimedArea
data.value: Disabled because there are no claimed areas where you have permission to respawn.

data.name: ContextMenu_Condition_NoSafezones
data.value: Disabled because there are no safe areas where you can respawn.

data.name: ContextMenu_Condition_LastRespawnInvalid
data.value: Disabled because you have no previous respawn available.

data.name: BannerEditor_NotInFaction
data.value: You have to be a house founder or leader to be able to edit the house banner.

data.name: ContextMenu_GiveIronKey_Tooltip
data.value: Iron Key: Give this person an iron key.

data.name: ContextMenu_GiveSilverKey_Tooltip
data.value: Silver Key: Give this person a silver key.

data.name: ContextMenu_GiveGoldKey_Tooltip
data.value: Gold Key: Give this person a gold key.

data.name: ContextMenu_ResetModel_Tooltip
data.value: Reset the character to the previous settings.

data.name: ContextMenu_Yaw_Tooltip
data.value: Change the yaw of the release to affect left/right position.

data.name: ContextMenu_Pitch_Tooltip
data.value: Change the pitch of the release to affect forward/back position.

data.name: ContextMenu_ReleaseAngle_Tooltip
data.value: Change the angle of the release to affect the timing.

data.name: ContextMenu_ConfigureRelease_Tooltip
data.value: Configure: Change the settings for the rope release.

data.name: Description_PlanetScenario
data.value: Planet with safe starting areas and caves to find and explore.

data.name: Text_SafezoneRemovalConfirmation
data.value: You are about remove a Safe Area respawn from the world. This will limit respawn options for characters. Are you sure you want to proceed?

data.name: DisplayName_Block_StoneWallRoundLargeRoundDoorOffsetBoth
data.value: Large Round Wall, Double Door Offset

data.name: DisplayName_Block_StoneWallRoundLargeRoundDoorOffsetLeft
data.value: Large Round Wall, Left Door Offset

data.name: DisplayName_Block_StoneWallRoundLargeRoundDoorOffsetRight
data.value: Large Round Wall, Right Door Offset

data.name: DisplayName_PlowSmelting
data.value: Melt a hand plow into ingots.

data.name: Description_Schematic_IronWorks
data.value: Unlocks basic blocks and items related to iron working. - Furnace - Smithy - Metal Parts - Large Wooden Chest - Unlocks research of Metal Hardening - Unlocks research of Farming - Unlocks research of Weaving - Unlocks research of Mechanics

data.name: Description_Schematic_Masonry
data.value: Unlocks more advanced stone works items. - Spiral Stairs - Small Round Walls - Large Walls - Tile Roofs

data.name: Description_Schematic_Hardening
data.value: Unlocks advanced tools and weapons. - Iron Hammer - Iron Axe - Pickaxe - Iron Shovel - Sword - Crossbow

data.name: Description_Schematic_StoneWorks
data.value: Unlocks basic stone blocks. - Walls - Stairs - Stone Claim Block - Wooden Gate - Projectiles - Unlocks research of Masonry - Unlocks research of Defensive Stone Works

data.name: Description_Schematic_DefensiveStoneWorks
data.value: Unlocks powerful defensive stone blocks. - Stone Cube - Drawbridge - Portcullis - Unlocks research of Battlements

data.name: Description_Schematic_Carpentry
data.value: Unlocks carpentry items. - Small Stockpile for Logs - Small Stockpile for Timbers - Small Stockpile for Ores - Round Timbers - Round Floor - Wooden Chair - Wooden Barrel - Wardrobe - Wooden Roofs - Wooden Shelf - Weapon Rack - Dining Table - Deer Plaque - Unlocks Wheelwrighting Research

data.name: Description_Schematic_Mechanics
data.value: Unlocks basic mechanical blocks. - Catapult Bucket - Rope Ends - Rope Drums - Hand Crank Wheel - Unlocks research of Advanced Mechanics

data.name: Description_Schematic_AdvancedMechanics
data.value: Unlocks more advanced mechanical blocks. - Locking Catch Blocks - Torsion Spring - Weight

data.name: Description_Schematic_Farming
data.value: Unlocks farming related items and blocks. - Hand Plow - Seed Bags - Stick Fence - Mill Stone - Unlocks research of Mechanized Farming Equipment

data.name: Description_Schematic_MechanizedFarmingEquipment
data.value: Unlocks more advanced farming equipment. - Plow - Harvester - Seeder

data.name: Description_Schematic_Weaving
data.value: Unlocks weaving related items and blocks. - Spinning Wheel - Banner Workstation - Banners and Flags - Bandages - Linen - Rope - Landscaping Stakes

data.name: DisplayName_Schematic_Cooking
data.value:
Cooking
Unlocks cooking recipes for campfire. - Mushroom Soup - Salad - Roots with Shrooms

data.name: Description_Schematic_GourmetCooking
data.value: Unlocks delicious and nutritious cooking recipes for campfire. - Goulash - Shroom Steak - Bread - Deer Pelt

data.name: Description_Schematic_WoodenDefences
data.value: Unlocks basic wooden defence blocks. - Palisade Walls - Palisade Battlements - Palisade Gate - Unlocks research of Wall-Walks

data.name: Description_Schematic_WheelWrighting
data.value: Unlocks basic wooden wheelwrighting blocks. - Wooden wheels - Catch Block

data.name: Description_Schematic_WallWalks
data.value: Unlocks wall-walk blocks. - Wall-Walk - Diagonal Wall-Walk - Large Round Wall-Walk - Small Stairs

data.name: Description_Quest_HumbleBeginnings_Step01
data.value: Engineers need tools. Find some sticks and stones to craft a stone axe. They can be found in the forest, stones are on the ground, and sticks can be pulled from the small trees.

data.name: Description_Quest_HumbleBeginnings_Step02
data.value: Great, all of the items have been gathered. Look in the inventory (Press I) to craft a stone axe.

data.name: Description_Quest_HumbleBeginnings_Step03
data.value: That's perfect! Equip the axe by dragging it to the toolbar, then cut a tree and chop it into logs. Remember to stay clear of falling trees!

data.name: Description_Quest_HumbleBeginnings_Step04
data.value: That'll do. Time to craft a crafting table! Open the inventory (Press I) and craft it.

data.name: Description_Quest_HumbleBeginnings_Step05
data.value: Now to place the table. Drag it to the toolbar, then close the inventory screen, activate it, and left-click to place it.

data.name: Description_Quest_HumbleBeginnings_Step06
data.value: Access the crafting table, first craft some timbers, then craft a bed. Add the bed to the inventory.

data.name: Description_Quest_HumbleBeginnings_Step07
data.value: Place the bed on the toolbar so you can place it in the world. Somewhere near the crafting table.

data.name: Description_Quest_HumbleBeginnings_Step08
data.value: Claim the bed so that it can be used as a respawn point.

data.name: Description_Quest_WarmthAndJoy_Step01
data.value: It's time to build a fire. Small stones are required, and an easy way to get them is by using a shovel. Craft a shovel.

data.name: Description_Quest_WarmthAndJoy_Step02
data.value: Equip the shovel and start digging the ground. Collect dirt by digging the soil.

data.name: Description_Quest_WarmthAndJoy_Step03
data.value: Now open your crafting screen and search the dirt for small stones. You can find this in the crafting recipes list.

data.name: Description_Quest_WarmthAndJoy_Step04
data.value: Use the small stones to craft a campfire.

data.name: Description_Quest_WarmthAndJoy_Step05
data.value: Place the campfire on the ground near the camp. By holding Ctrl, and using the Mouse Wheel, it is possible to position the campfire above the ground.

data.name: Description_Quest_HungryBellies_Step01
data.value: Eating raw mushrooms can keep a person alive but engineers can do better. Start by finding some mushrooms, roots and berries in the forest.

data.name: Description_Quest_HungryBellies_Step02
data.value: Return to the campfire. Add the mushrooms, roots, and berries to the fire. Provide some wooden sticks as fuel and cook some Mushroom Soup.

data.name: Description_Quest_HungryBellies_Step03
data.value: Right-click on the Mushroom Soup to eat them.

data.name: Description_Quest_SettlingDown_Step01
data.value: Time to start preparing resources, cut another tree.

data.name: Description_Quest_SettlingDown_Step02
data.value: Next, to build things the correct tool is required. Craft a wooden mallet.

data.name: Description_Quest_SettlingDown_Step03
data.value: Open the G-Screen by pressing "G", then drag the Log Stockpile to the toolbar. Place the log stockpile into the world. The block can be rotated using the Q and E keys.

data.name: Description_Quest_SettlingDown_Step04
data.value: Now, hammer away at the block until it is fully finished. The progress can be seen in the block info panel.

data.name: Description_Quest_BrighterTomorrow_Step01
data.value: All engineers know how to build basic blocks. By doing research, engineers can learn how to build many more things. Prepare by crafting some timbers.

data.name: Description_Quest_BrighterTomorrow_Step02
data.value: Great! Use the timbers in the Crafting Table to make a Research table.

data.name: Description_Quest_BrighterTomorrow_Step03
data.value: Place the research table somewhere in the world. Use Research tables to unlock new items.

data.name: Description_Quest_BrighterTomorrow_Step04
data.value: Carpentry is a good starting point. Gather the items needed to research it. You can see what is needed by clicking on Carpentry while accessing the Research Table.

data.name: Description_Quest_BrighterTomorrow_Step05
data.value: All of the items have been gathered. Produce Carpentry research and then right-click on the schematic to learn it.

data.name: ActionHint_GatherSmallTree
data.value: Press {0} to harvest the small tree.

data.name: Description_ControlCategory_GUI
data.value: Controls used for interaction in GUI.

data.name: Description_ControlCategory_General
data.value: General controls used to access and navigate menu screens.

data.name: Description_ControlCategory_Character
data.value: Character-related controls used to move and interact with the world.

data.name: Description_ControlCategory_Tools
data.value: Controls for using/equipping tools and weapons.

data.name: Description_ControlCategory_Building
data.value: Controls used to place and manipulate blocks in the world..

data.name: Description_ControlCategory_Spectator
data.value: Controls used to control the spectator view.

data.name: Description_Control_PrimaryClick
data.value: The primary button used to click on things in menus.

data.name: Description_Control_SecondaryClick
data.value: The secondary button used to click on things in menus.

data.name: Description_Control_Confirm
data.value: This is a contextual action. Examples of use are opening/closing a dropdown box, toggling a check box, or pressing a button.

data.name: Description_Control_CloseScreen
data.value: This is the same as clicking the X at the top right of the screen.

data.name: Description_Control_ShareInput
data.value: This is used to override default input to access debug controls with the mouse.

data.name: Description_Control_MainMenu
data.value: Open the main menu screen while playing the game. The main menu can be used to save or load a world, change game options, exit from the world, read the news, or report a bug.

data.name: Description_Control_Blueprints
data.value: Open the blueprints screen while playing the game. The blueprints screen can be used to access and edit your blueprints library, choose blueprints to add to the world, or publish blueprints to the steam workshop.

data.name: Description_Control_AdminMenu
data.value: Open the medieval master screen while playing the game. The medieval master screen contains controls for editing the world. *You will need to be a world administrator if you are connected to a multiplayer server or dedicated server.

data.name: Description_Control_SpawnItemMenu
data.value: Open the spawn item screen while playing the game. The spawn item screen allows you to specify a quantity of items to add to the world or directly to the character's inventory. *You will need to be in creative mode or have medieval master enabled.

data.name: Description_Control_ToolbarConfig
data.value: Open the toolbar configuration screen while playing the game. The toolbar configuration screen allows items to be added or removed from the toolbars. It shows the blocks that can be placed in the current world with the exception of craftable blocks when playing in survival.

data.name: Description_Control_FactionsScreen
data.value: Open the house configuration screen while playing the game. The house configuration screen allows for creation and joining of houses.

data.name: Description_Control_PlayersScreen
data.value: Open the player list while playing the game. The player list contains all of the players connected to the current game, as well as controls to promote players to administrator, invite new players, kick players, or mute player's voice chat.

data.name: Description_Control_InventoryScreen
data.value: Open the character inventory screen. The character inventory screen can be used to drop inventory items, add inventory items to the toolbars, or craft new items.

data.name: Description_Control_HelpScreen
data.value: Open the help screen. The help screen displays a list of controls and their key bindings.

data.name: Description_Control_PauseGame
data.value: Pause the game. This is only available for single player.

data.name: Description_Control_TakeScreenshot
data.value: Take a screenshot of the game. The screenshot will be saved to %appdata%\MedievalEngineers\Screenshots\

data.name: Description_Control_ToggleHud
data.value: Toggle the HUD visibility. This feature is most useful for making videos or screenshots with external applications.

data.name: Description_Control_ChatScreen
data.value: Open the chat screen while in the game. The chat screen allows you to send text messages to other characters in the same world.

data.name: Description_Control_VoiceChat
data.value: Hold to enable voice chat while in the game. Voice chat is range based. This means that the farther a chatting character is from another character, the lower the characters volume will be for the other character.

data.name: Description_Control_MapScreen
data.value: Open the map screen while playing the game. The map screen shows information about character and building locations, as well as provides information about on-going events, and provides access to fast travel.

data.name: Description_Control_QuestLog
data.value: Open the quest log screen while in the game. The quest log has controls for choosing the active quest and abandoning the active quest.

data.name: Description_Control_ClipboardCut
data.value: Cut an item or block(s) from the world and stores it in the clipboard. Cut is only available in creative mode or with medieval master enabled.

data.name: Description_Control_ClipboardCopy
data.value: Copie an item or block(s) from the world and stores it in the clipboard. Also equips the copied item to be pasted immediately.

data.name: Description_Control_ClipboardPaste
data.value: Paste an item or block(s) from the clipboard into the world.

data.name: Description_Control_QuickSave
data.value: Quick save makes a normal save of the world without the need to use the main menu.

data.name: Description_Control_QuickLoadReconnect
data.value: Quick load opens the last save without the need to use the main menu.

data.name: Description_Control_MoveForward
data.value: Move the character in a forward direction.

data.name: Description_Control_MoveBackward
data.value: Move the character in a backward direction.

data.name: Description_Control_StrafeLeft
data.value: Move the character to the left in a strafing movement.

data.name: Description_Control_StrafeRight
data.value: Move the character to the right in a strafing movement.

data.name: Description_Control_AutoForward
data.value: Move the character forward until auto-walk is pressed again or an interrupting movement key is pressed.

data.name: Description_Control_Crouch
data.value: Make the character crouch to fit in smaller spaces or hide behind objects.

data.name: Description_Control_Jump
data.value: Make the character jump into the air.

data.name: Description_Control_CharacterFly
data.value: Turn the flight ability on / off.

data.name: Description_Control_CharacterUse
data.value: Use or interact with the object that the character is looking at.

data.name: Description_Control_CharacterTorch
data.value: Equip a torch if it is available in the character's inventory or unequip an already equipped torch.

data.name: Description_Control_CameraSwitch
data.value: Switch the view to either 1st person perspective or 3rd person perspective.

data.name: Description_Control_Sprint
data.value: Run as fast as possible. This will consume stamina quickly.

data.name: Description_Control_Die
data.value: Some situations just cannot be escaped...

data.name: Description_Control_RollLeft
data.value: Roll to the left on the 3rd axis when flying.

data.name: Description_Control_RollRight
data.value: Roll to the right on the 3rd axis when flying.

data.name: Description_Control_PitchUp
data.value: Look higher when on the ground or pitch the character's body upwards when flying.

data.name: Description_Control_PitchDown
data.value: Look lower when on the ground or pitch the character's body downwards when flying.

data.name: Description_Control_YawLeft
data.value: Look to the left when on the ground or spin to the left when flying.

data.name: Description_Control_YawRight
data.value: Look to the right when on the ground or spin to the right when flying.

data.name: Description_Control_PitchAxis
data.value: The analog control for the vertical axis. Usually a mouse or gamepad joystick.

data.name: Description_Control_YawAxis
data.value: The analog control for the horizontal axis. Usually a mouse or gamepad joystick.

data.name: Description_Control_Teleport
data.value: Teleportuje postavu na poz√≠ciu, kde sa nach√°dza kamera div√°ka. Teleport je dostupn√Ω len v tvorivom re≈æime hry, alebo ak je povolen√Ω Stredovek√Ω majster.

data.name: Description_Control_LookAround
data.value: Hold and use the analog controls to rotate the camer. In 1st person character view and free spectator view this will aim the camera. In 3rd person character view and follow spectator view this will rotate the camera around the character.

data.name: Description_Control_SpectatorNone
data.value: Pohlaƒè z postavy. Deaktivuje re≈æim div√°ka.

data.name: Description_Control_SpectatorFree
data.value: Move spectator freely through the world. Use the mouse scroll wheel to adjust speed.

data.name: Description_Control_SpectatorRollLeft
data.value: Roll spectator left in the world.

data.name: Description_Control_SpectatorRollRight
data.value: Roll spectator right in the world.

data.name: Description_Control_SpectatorPitchAxis
data.value: The analog control for the spectator's vertical axis. Usually a mouse or gamepad joystick.

data.name: Description_Control_SpectatorYawAxis
data.value: The analog control for the spectator's horizontal axis. Usually a mouse or gamepad joystick.

data.name: Description_Control_CubeRotateVerticalPos
data.value: Rotate the block about to be placed vertially up from the character's perspective.

data.name: Description_Control_CubeRotateVerticalNeg
data.value: Rotate the block about to be placed vertially down from the character's perspective.

data.name: Description_Control_CubeRotateHorisontalPos
data.value: Rotate the block about to be placed horizontally to the right from the character's perspective.

data.name: Description_Control_CubeRotateHorisontalNeg
data.value: Rotate the block about to be placed horizontally to the left from the character's perspective.

data.name: Description_Control_CubeRotateRollPos
data.value: Roll the block about to be placed to the right from the character's perspective.

data.name: Description_Control_CubeRotateRollNeg
data.value: Roll the block about to be placed to the left from the character's perspective.

data.name: Description_Control_NextBlockVariant
data.value: Switch to the next block variant. Some blocks are grouped together and indicated with a "+" icon. Each block in the group is called a variant as they are similar in function.

data.name: Description_Control_PrevBlockVariant
data.value: Switch to the previous block variant. Some blocks are grouped together and indicated with a "+" icon. Each block in the group is called a variant as they are similar in function.

data.name: Description_Control_MoveCloser
data.value: Move the block about to be placed closer to the character.

data.name: Description_Control_MoveFurther
data.value: Move the block about to be placed farther away from the character.

data.name: Description_Control_SwitchLeft
data.value: Select the previous material in the list. This is used in conjunction with the voxel tools.

data.name: Description_Control_SwitchRight
data.value: Select the next material in the list. This is used in conjunction with the voxel tools.

data.name: Description_Control_SwitchBuildingMode
data.value: Switch between static and dynamic placement. This is available only when using paste.

data.name: Description_Control_CompoundBuilding
data.value: Hold to quickly switch compound mode to the opposite of its current setting.

data.name: Description_Control_PickBlock
data.value: Add the block or tool the character is aiming at to the toolbar.

data.name: Description_Control_StructuralIntergrityView
data.value: View the real-time structural integrity of buildings in the world.

data.name: Description_Control_CreateBlueprint
data.value: Add a blueprint of what the character is looking at to the blueprint library.

data.name: Description_Control_ToolPrimary
data.value: The main or first action of the tool or weapon. This is used for attacking, constructing, mining, etc.

data.name: Description_Control_ToolSecondary
data.value: The secondary action of the tool or weapon. This generally performs the opposite of the primary action.

data.name: Description_Control_ToolTertiary
data.value: Alternate function of the tool or weapon.

data.name: Description_Control_ToolModifier
data.value: Hold to alter the behavior of the selected tool. Only supported on some tools.

data.name: Description_Control_ToolbarItem1
data.value: Equip the item in toolbar slot 1.

data.name: Description_Control_ToolbarItem2
data.value: Equip the item in toolbar slot 2.

data.name: Description_Control_ToolbarItem3
data.value: Equip the item in toolbar slot 3.

data.name: Description_Control_ToolbarItem4
data.value: Equip the item in toolbar slot 4.

data.name: Description_Control_ToolbarItem5
data.value: Equip the item in toolbar slot 5.

data.name: Description_Control_ToolbarItem6
data.value: Equip the item in toolbar slot 6.

data.name: Description_Control_ToolbarItem7
data.value: Equip the item in toolbar slot 7.

data.name: Description_Control_ToolbarItem8
data.value: Equip the item in toolbar slot 8.

data.name: Description_Control_ToolbarItem9
data.value: Equip the item in toolbar slot 9.

data.name: Description_Control_ToolbarItemDeselect
data.value: Unequip toolbar item. This will remove the block placer from the characters view and allow for empty-hand actions such as picking things up to inventory, picking things up with the manipulation tool, and pulling things with the rope tool.

data.name: Description_Control_ToolbarItemNext
data.value: Select the next item on the toolbar.

data.name: Description_Control_ToolbarItemPrev
data.value: Select the previous item on the toolbar.

data.name: Description_Consumables_Berries
data.value: Berries are red and grow on bushes. They can be picked only when they are fully grown. Berries have no effect on health and stamina, but satisfy hunger by a small amount. They are more nutritional when cooked as an ingredient in other foods. Berry bushes can be found in the forest or in rocky grasses.

data.name: Description_Consumables_Cabbage
data.value: Cabbages are green, round and grow on the ground. They have no effect on health and stamina, but satisfy hunger by a small amount. They are more nutritional when cooked as an ingredient in other foods. Cabbages can be found only in grass.

data.name: Description_Consumables_Pumpkin
data.value: Pumpkins are orange and grown on vines. They can be picked only when they are fully grown. Pumpkins have no effect on health but, due to their large size, they temporarily reduce stamina after consumption. Pumpkins provide 9 food. They are more nutritional when cooked as an ingredient in other foods. Pumpkin vines grow only in grass.

data.name: Description_Consumables_Mushrooms
data.value: Mushrooms are white and brown and grow in small groups on the ground. They have no effect on health and stamina, but satisfy hunger by a small amount. Mushrooms are more nutritional when cooked as an ingredient in other foods. They grow only in the forest.

data.name: Description_Consumables_Herbs
data.value: Herbs are blue and grow on tall, thin stalks. They have no effect on health and stamina, but satisfy hunger by a small amount. They are more nutritional when cooked as an ingredient in other foods. Herb plants grow on grass, rocky grass, and soil.

data.name: Description_Consumables_Roots
data.value: Roots are dark brown and grow close to the ground. They have no effect on health and stamina, but satisfy hunger by a small amount. They are more nutritional when cooked as an ingredient in other foods. Roots can be found in the forest, rocky grass, grass, and soil.

data.name: Description_Consumables_Meat
data.value: Meat can be harvested from dead animals. It has no effect on health, but provides a small boost to stamina and reduces hunger by a medium amount. Meat is more nutritional when cooked either alone or as an ingredient in other foods.

data.name: Description_Consumables_RoastMeat
data.value: Roast Meat is produced by cooking raw Meat. It has no effect on health but provides a moderate boost to stamina and reduces hunger by a significant amount. Roast Meat, although more nutritional than raw Meat, is more nutritional when cooked as an ingredient in other foods.

data.name: Description_Consumables_Bandage
data.value: Bandages are crafted using healing herbs. They have no effect on food and stamina, but restore a large amount of health.

data.name: Description_Consumables_Bread
data.value: Bread is produced by cooking flour. It has no effect on stamina but provides a moderate boost to health and satisfies hunger by a fair amount.

data.name: Description_Item_StoneSmall
data.value: Small stones can be found on the ground individually or in small groups. They can be found in the forest or on soil.

data.name: Description_Item_LargeStone
data.value: Large stones can be mined from the ground. They can only be produced from rocky ground.

data.name: Description_Item_DeerSkin
data.value: Deer Skin can be harvested only from dead deer.

data.name: Description_Item_Antlers
data.value: Antlers can be harvested only from dead deer.

data.name: Description_Item_FlaxStraws
data.value: Flax is a flowering plant with blue petals. It grows only in grass.

data.name: Description_Item_WheatStraws
data.value: Wheat is a tall grass that is golden yellow when it is ripe. It grows only in grass.

data.name: Description_Item_Log
data.value: Logs are used to produce many items and blocks. They can be harvested from trees in the forest by first cutting down the tree and then chopping it into logs.

data.name: Description_Item_WoodenSticks
data.value: Wooden Sticks are used to produce many items and blocks. The can be produced from logs and tree stumps. The more efficient way to produce Wooden Sticks is to craft them from a Log. Branches can also be used as a substitute for Wooden Sticks.

data.name: Description_Item_Timber
data.value: Timbers can be used to build with or to produce many items and blocks. They can be crafted from logs.

data.name: Description_Item_TimberRound
data.value: Round Timbers can be used to build with or to produce many items and blocks. They can be crafted from logs.

data.name: Description_Item_MetalParts
data.value: Metal parts are used to craft items and blocks that use metal in their construction. They are crafted from Iron Ingots in the Smithy.

data.name: Description_Item_IronIngot
data.value: Iron Ingots are used to craft metal items and blocks with metal construction. They are created by smelting Iron Ore in the Furnace.

data.name: Description_Item_Rope
data.value: Rope is used by many blocks. It is crafted on the spinning wheel from Linen String.

data.name: Description_Item_LinenString
data.value: Linen String is used to craft items and blocks. It is crafted on the spinning wheel from Flax Straws.

data.name: Description_Item_WheatFlourSack
data.value: Flour Sacks are used as an ingredient to cook bread. They are produced on the Mill Stone using Wheat Straws.

data.name: Description_Ore_IronOre
data.value: Iron Ore is smelted in the Furnace to produce Iron Ingots. It is mined from the ground and can be located by its reddish color or by the way it tints nearby vegetation an orange color. There are varying concentrations of Iron Ore found in deposits.

data.name: Description_DirtToSmallStones
data.value: Searching through dirt will often turn up some small stones that can be used for crafting.

data.name: Description_Item_CrossbowBolt
data.value: A bolt that is appropriate for use as ammunition in a crossbow. Each bolt is good for one use only.

data.name: Description_Weapon_Club
data.value: A crude melee weapon, the club is easy to produce but suffers from low durability.

data.name: Description_Weapon_BrokenSword
data.value: An unfortunate melee weapon, the broken sword inflicts little damage. Although it was once a durable weapon, the damage to the blade weakens it.

data.name: Description_Tool_Crossbow
data.value: A high-tech ranged weapon, the crossbow can easily fire bolts over a long distance. Zoom in for maximum accuracy.

data.name: Description_Weapon_Mace
data.value: A simple melee weapon, the mace is favored by barbarians. The metal in its construction gives it a higher durability than a simple club.

data.name: Description_Weapon_Sword
data.value: A refined melee weapon, the sword is forged from solid iron. This results in a highly durable weapon that can inflict large amounts of damage.

data.name: Description_Tool_WoodenMallet
data.value: A simple tool, the wooden mallet is easy to produce. It suffers from low productivity and durability but it gets the job done. Wooden mallets are used for construction of large structures and deconstruction of just about anything.

data.name: Description_Tool_Hammer
data.value: A sturdy tool, the iron hammer is highly productive. Its metal construction makes it more durable than many other tools. Iron hammers are used for construction of large structures and deconstruction of just about antyhing.

data.name: Description_Herring
data.value: An ultimate tool of tree chopping, the red herring is unmatched in its ability clear entire forest. Some engineers claim that the herring is so productive it can clear a forest in minutes.

data.name: Description_Tool_HandPlow
data.value: A necessary tool, the hand plow is the only non-mechanized means of preparing land for farming. Even with iron construction, the hand plow isn't very productive and suffers from low durability.

data.name: Description_Rope_Basic
data.value: An easily understood tool, basic rope is strong and used to connect things together. It can be attached to rope endings and rope drums to tie or pull things.

data.name: Description_Rope_TearableRope
data.value: For more specific uses, tearable rope can tie things together but be easily torn when touched.

data.name: Description_Tool_WoodenShovel
data.value: A tool with many uses, the wooden shovel can both add and remove dirt. Used in combination with landscaping stakes and rope, the shovel can be used to level dirt and create ramps. Its simple to craft but suffers from low durability. The wooden shovel can also be used to gather small amounts of iron rich dirt from near iron deposits.

data.name: Description_Tool_IronShovel
data.value: A tool with many uses, the iron shovel can both add and remove dirt. Used in combination with landscaping stakes and rope, the shovel can be used to level dirt and create ramps. Its iron reinforcement makes it more durable than the basic wooden version. The iron shovel can also be used to gather small amounts of iron rich dirt from near iron deposits.

data.name: Description_Torch
data.value: Easily produced, torches can be carried to provide light. Their wooden construction means they are quickly consumed by their own fire.

data.name: Description_Tool_StoneAxe
data.value: The simplest tool, the stone axe can be made from nothing more than a stick and a stone. It will cut down a tree and make logs out of it with a lot of work, but it has very little durability and no other use.

data.name: Description_Tool_IronAxe
data.value: A refined tool of wood destruction, the iron axe is highly efficient at felling trees and cutting logs.

data.name: Description_Tool_Pickaxe
data.value: A hardened iron tool, the pickaxe can mine stone and solid ore.

data.name: Description_Tool_SeedBag
data.value: A simple bag containing prepared seeds. These can be planted by hand or used in a mechanized seeder

data.name: DisplayName_Block_StoneWallRoundLargeArrowSlitBoth
data.value: Large Round Wall, Double Arrow Slit

data.name: DisplayName_Block_StoneWallRoundLargeArrowSlitLeft
data.value: Large Round Wall, Right Arrow Slit

data.name: DisplayName_Block_StoneWallRoundLargeArrowSlitRight
data.value: Large Round Wall, Left Arrow Slit
